Healthy Vegan Recipes

Find healthy, delicious vegan recipes, from the food and nutrition experts at EatingWell.

Rainbow Veggie Spring Roll Bowl

This deconstructed version of a spring roll packs in tons of colorful vegetables for a delicious gluten-free and vegan noodle bowl.

Vegan Pancakes

These pancakes are the real deal –classic, light and fluffy—you wouldn't even know they're vegan!

Vegan Smoothie Bowl

A banana and frozen berries whip up into the frosty base in this vegan smoothie bowl recipe.

  • Newest
  • Title

    • 22-Day Vegan Meal Plan

    Following a vegan diet is a healthy approach to eating when you fill your plate with a balance of vegetables, fruits, whole grains and legumes. These next-level vegan recipes are packed with wholesome ingredients and fantastic flavors that will leave you feeling nourished and satisfied. Even if you're not a full-time vegan, these recipes are a great way to start eating a more plant-based diet.

Almost Chipotle's Guacamole

Make guacamole at home that tastes just like it came from Chipotle--but don't worry, our version won't be "extra"! This deliciously fresh guac is perfect for topping burrito bowls or tacos, or serve as an appetizer or healthy snack with tortilla chips and veggies.

Shortbread Pecan Pie Crust

Looking for a pie crust that's gluten-free, vegan and devourably delicious? This is the only recipe you'll need. Chewy pecans and crisp oats combine in the food processor with coconut oil and maple syrup for an easy-to-prepare pie crust (no rolling necessary!) that's packed with flavor and reminiscent of classic shortbread.

Apple & Pistachios

This apple & pistachio combo is a well-rounded and satisfying snack.
ADVERTISEMENT

Everything Bagel Avocado Toast

Get all the flavor of an "everything" bagel married with the creaminess of avocado toast in one healthy breakfast. Just toast, top, sprinkle and go for this quick morning meal when you need to get out the door fast. Want to take it up a notch? Top with a poached or fried egg.
ADVERTISEMENT

Microwaved Fresh Green Beans

Steaming green beans in the microwave is quick and convenient, helping you to get dinner on the table in minutes. This basic recipe is a great starting point for the seasoning of your choice--a little butter, toasted nuts or a creamy sauce.

Pistachios & Apricots

Dried fruit and nuts is a classic snack that never gets old. Tip: Use shell-on pistachios--shelling them will force you to eat slower and really savor your snack time.

Sautéed Butternut Squash

Sautéeing butternut squash in olive oil quickly yields perfectly cooked results and slighly caramelizes the squash for extra flavor. This recipe makes a delicious vegetable side dish to pair with roasted meats.

Vegan Scalloped Potatoes

These scalloped potatoes are surprisingly rich and creamy even though they're made with no dairy (milk, butter or cheese)--vegan comfort food at its best. We use almond milk, herbs and spices to make a flavorful sauce and finish the dish with a crunchy almond topping. This makes a satisfying side dish if you're cooking for dairy-free or vegan diets.

Blueberry Compote

Simmering wild blueberries with lemon zest and vanilla makes a tasty quick jam or dessert topping. Serve the compote on pancakes, stir it into yogurt or use it to top ice cream.

Holiday Spice Punch

This punch recipe is a good strong sipper, ideal for warming up on a cold day. As the ice melts, the drink mellows a bit and this punch actually gets better and better as the evening wears on.
ADVERTISEMENT

Blistered Green Beans with Coconut, Sesame & Scallion Oil

Coconut helps accentuate the natural sweetness of green beans in this healthy skillet-roasted vegetable side dish. A drizzle of the ginger- and scallion-infused oil rounds out the flavors. Serve with miso-glazed salmon or cod and brown rice.

Cinnamon Apples

A sprinkle of cinnamon adds the perfect touch to a juicy and sweet apple. Enjoy this as an easy and nutritious evening snack.

Oatmeal Raisin Granola Bars

These bars, packed with the sweet flavors of raisins and cinnamon, are inspired by oatmeal raisin cookies--but they're completely nut-free so they're school-friendly. We tested several sticky sweeteners, including maple syrup and honey, but found brown rice syrup held the bars together the best.

Vegan Cauliflower Alfredo

4
Unbelievably rich and creamy, this easy vegan Alfredo is bound to become a favorite. Be sure to check the ingredient list on your unsweetened almond milk, as some contain vanilla flavoring even if they aren't labeled as such. For this recipe, you'll want almond milk without any vanilla.

Avocado Aioli

Avocado takes the place of eggs in this aioli, making it super luscious and creamy. Reprinted from Real Food Heals by arrangement with Avery Books, a member of Penguin Group (USA) LLC, A Penguin Random House Company. Copyright © 2017, Seamus Mullen

Carrot Hummus

Carrots, rich in beta carotene, combine with fiber-filled garbanzo beans to make this a great dip recipe for snacks or a spread for sandwiches.

Curried Pumpkin and Mushroom Risotto

1
Fresh mushrooms and curry powder provide layers of flavor to this risotto, which gets creaminess from pumpkin and from slow-simmering the arborio rice in the traditional risotto method.

Green Salad with Pita Bread & Hummus

Elevate hummus and pita by piling your plate high with cucumbers, carrots and mixed greens! Just a drizzle of balsamic vinegar and extra-virgin olive oil is all it takes to dress it up.

Green Salad with Edamame & Beets

1
This big salad is a feast for the eyes and an everyday way to incorporate nutrient-rich beets and plant-based protein from edamame (green soybeans). If you're not a fan of cilantro, mix in freshly chopped basil or dill instead.

Green Tahini Ranch Dip

Fresh spinach and herbs blended with tahini and garlic make this tahini dip recipe perfect for crudités--or try it as a vegan alternative to regular ranch dressing.

Peanut Butter & Fig Crispbreads

Eating fiber-rich rye crisps (or rye bread), such as Danish open-face smørrebrøds, at breakfast (instead of white bread) may help you feel satisfied longer and help keep blood sugar levels steady. This version is our take on a healthier PB&J.
ADVERTISEMENT

Banana-Peanut Granola Bars

These healthy, homemade granola bars are reminiscent of peanut butter-and-banana sandwiches. Be sure to look for dried banana, not banana chips. The chips are cooked in oil and, if not stored properly, can have an off taste. We tested several sticky sweeteners, including maple syrup and honey, but found brown rice syrup held the bars together the best.

Spinach & Dill Pasta Salad

Edamame gives this veggie-packed vegan pasta salad a bit of feel-full protein. Serve topped with extra freshly ground pepper, if desired.

Sautéed Carrots with Gomasio

In this quick vegetable side dish, maple-vinegar-glazed carrots are topped with gomasio, a blend of toasted sesame seeds and salt. Find gomasio in the natural-foods section or Asian-foods section at large supermarkets or at Asian markets. Or substitute 2 tablespoons toasted sesame seeds and 1/4 teaspoon salt.

Apricot-Strawberry Smoothie

Combine fresh apricots with frozen strawberries in this healthy smoothie recipe for a perfectly frosty way to cool down all summer long.

Cocoa-Chia Pudding with Raspberries

1
Have chocolate for breakfast with this unbelievably healthy chia pudding recipe. The deep chocolaty flavor pairs perfectly with juicy raspberries for a fun switch-up from oatmeal for your morning routine.

Coconut Grilled Corn

Grilled corn turns up across the globe, from Japan's supernaturally sweet Hokkaido corn to Mexico's elote, grilled corn slathered with mayonnaise and grated Cotija cheese. In this healthy corn on the cob recipe, the corn takes its inspiration from Cambodia's pod oeng, corn grilled with pandan leaf–flavored coconut milk.

Sweet & Spicy Baked Beans

With heat from chipotles in adobo sauce and sweetness from brown sugar, this healthy stovetop baked beans recipe is a spicy twist on the classic. We slashed more than half the sugar and three-quarters of the sodium--and a few hours of cooking time--as compared to a traditional recipe. Serve at your next cookout or BBQ and be prepared for people to rave.

Layered Strawberry-Mango Margaritas

1
Swirl layers of red strawberry margarita with yellow mango margarita in this skinny frozen cocktail for a festive party drink that will wow your guests. It tastes just as good as a restaurant frozen margarita, without all the sugar!

Frozen Pineapple Margaritas

1
These frosty pineapple margaritas taste just like restaurant-style frozen margaritas, but without all the sugar, for a skinny cocktail you can easily whip up at home.

All Greens Smoothie Bowl

1
This smoothie combines the radiance-boosting power of green fruits and veggies, including watercress, which is high in phytonutrients and vitamins K, C and A. (Recipe developed by Lily Kunin for Bobbi Brown's Beauty from the Inside Out, Chronicle Books, copyright 2017.)

Red Fruit Salad

Serve this refreshing fruit salad featuring juicy watermelon, grapes and berries on its own or with other colorblock fruit salads (like green, purple and orange) for a fun, crowd-pleasing rainbow side dish.

Virgin Banana Piña Colada Pops

1
The tropical flavors of a piña colada make for one delicious ice pop. Be sure to reach for ripe bananas to get the perfect sweetness (without any added sugar!) for this clean-eating-friendly frozen treat.

2-Ingredient Peanut Butter Banana Ice Cream

3
Whir up frozen bananas into an “ice cream” without the cream! Peanut butter adds a natural swirl of flavor for a sweet and satisfying dessert with no added sugar.

Blood Orange Margaritas

Fresh blood orange juice gives this stunning pink cocktail just the right balance of sweet and sour. For the perfect finish, upgrade the salt rim on your glass by mixing in a little orange zest to add to both the presentation and flavor of these skinny margaritas.

Ssamjang

One taste of this Korean sauce and it'll become a refrigerator staple. Smear on lettuce wraps or serve with any grilled meat.
ADVERTISEMENT

Grilled Corn & Carrot Giardiniera

In this spicy-sweet marinated vegetable recipe, harissa and jalapeño lend quite a bit of heat, so adjust to your taste. Serve the giardiniera with grilled chicken or steak, or on top of your favorite salad for a vinegary bite.

BBQ Carrot Dogs

6
Shock everyone with this recipe for veggie dogs that actually taste like hot dogs. They're an amazing (and healthy!) vegan alternative to traditional meat hot dogs. Serve in whole-wheat hot dog buns and top with all your favorite toppings, such as sauerkraut, relish, ketchup and mustard, for the ultimate barbecue meal.

Roasted Root Veggies & Greens over Spiced Lentils

This earthy bowl of lentils bursting with Middle Eastern flavors is topped with leftover roasted root veggies from a large batch for an easy weeknight dinner. Keep it vegan or add a drizzle of plain yogurt for extra richness.
ADVERTISEMENT

Rhubarb Simple Syrup

Fresh rhubarb gives this easy simple-syrup recipe a bright and beautiful color. Try it topped with Champagne or prosecco for a quick cocktail.

Tropical Fruit & Nuts Snack

With 4 grams of protein and 4 grams of fiber, this healthy packable snack can help you feel full until your next meal.

Elderflower Champagne Cocktail

Elderflower adds sweet and fruity notes that mingle seamlessly with mint in this refreshing Champagne cocktail.

Veggie Spring Rolls

2
Don't be intimidated by these vibrant spring rolls--they're easier to make than you might think. Stuffed with fresh raw vegetables, these stunners are an impressive healthy vegan appetizer for your next gathering.

Coconut Peanut Butter Balls

3
All you need are four simple ingredients to make healthier coconutty peanut butter balls that kids and grownups will love. Make this easy recipe for a bite-size treat, on-the-go snack or easy homemade gift. You can swap the peanut butter for almond butter or even sunflower seed butter if you need a nut-free snack for school.

Sweet Potato Chips

1
Make perfectly crunchy veggie chips at home with this healthy recipe. Use a mandoline to slice the sweet potatoes extra-thin for the optimum crunch!

Garlic Hummus

2
This classic hummus recipe couldn't be easier--just toss a few ingredients in the food processor and whir away! Aquafaba (the liquid from a can of chickpeas) makes this healthy dip extra smooth and creamy. Serve with veggie chips, pita chips or crudités.

Roasted Cauliflower & Potato Curry Soup

16
In this healthy cauliflower soup recipe, roasting the cauliflower first adds depth and prevents the florets from turning to mush. A little tomato sauce and coconut milk give the broth a rich, silky texture. Serve with a dollop of sour cream or yogurt, if desired.
ADVERTISEMENT

Garlic Mashed Cauliflower

Whir cauliflower into a creamy low-carb substitute for mashed potatoes. This easy recipe gets a kick of flavor from garlic-infused olive oil, making it a dairy-free (and vegan) vegetable side dish.

Vegan Pumpkin Pie

This dairy-free pumpkin pie gets its structure from aquafaba (the leftover water from a can of chickpeas) whipped up into a meringue-like foam. When it's combined with pumpkin and poured into a gluten-free pecan crust, you would never know beans had anything to do with this easy dessert recipe.

Hoppin‘ John with Orange Bell Peppers

1
Loads of ham hocks, cured pork belly or even smoked turkey wings are usually key ingredients in this Southern dish. In this healthy Hoppin‘ John recipe, smoked paprika and cayenne pepper bring on the flavor. Ounce-for-ounce, these two spices contain roughly 2 1/2 times the beta carotene of boiled sweet potatoes. Serve as a main-dish stew or serve a smaller portion as a side along with some brown rice.

Orange-Oregano Marinated Vegetables

Negocie crudités simples por algo con más garbo con esta receta rápida de vegetales marinados. Remoje los pimientos, hinojo y corazones de alcachofa congelados en un adobo con sabor a naranja y orégano y en solo un par de horas tendrá un sabroso antipasto listo para servir con su plato de queso.

Ensalada de manzanas, higos y coles de Bruselas

El aderezo de ensalada elaborado con vinagre balsámico blanco dulce y suave equilibra los asertivos verdes y las coles de Bruselas en esta saludable ensalada de invierno. Si tiene uno a mano, una mandolina pequeña facilita cortar el Bruselas y la manzana. Para hacer una ensalada de cena, cubra con camarones o pollo.

Aceitunas de hierbas

1
Las hierbas secas y el ajo picado decoran sus aceitunas favoritas.

Pudín de "Chocomole"

2
Los aguacates cremosos hacen que esta receta de postre de chocolate vegano y sin lácteos sea súper rica. Sirve como un postre no tan dulce o con fresas para mojar.

Ensalada de piña y aguacate

3
Esta receta refrescante y simple de ensalada cubana captura los sabores de los trópicos. Sirva junto con pollo o cerdo con especias, con arroz y frijoles.

Jugo verde

4
Esta receta saludable de jugo verde combina perejil, espinacas, peras y apio para hacer un jugo lleno de vitamina K con soporte óseo. ¿Sin exprimidor? No hay problema. Vea la variación de jugo a continuación para hacer esta receta de jugo verde en una licuadora.

Cuñas de polenta con tapenade de tomate

2
Los crujientes trozos de polenta coronados con una tapenade de tomate picante y secada al sol hacen un aperitivo bonito y sabroso.

Papas fritas de microondas

17
No necesita una freidora para hacer papas fritas crujientes. Lanzamos papas en rodajas finas con solo un toque de aceite de oliva, las colocamos en el microondas y ¡voilà! Patatas crujientes crujientes caseras con 8 gramos menos de grasa por porción que las papas fritas normales.
ADVERTISEMENT

Sorbete de ciruela

Esta receta de sorbete de ciruela de color rojo rubí es perfecta para niños y adultos que buscan una dulce golosina. Asegúrese de recoger las ciruelas que estén maduras pero no magulladas.

Sorbete de naranja y zarzamora

1
Esta receta de sorbete de naranja y zarzamora es un hermoso regalo púrpura perfecto para cualquier día caluroso. Si bien puede parecer tedioso, asegúrese de colar las moras y use una pulpa baja o jugo de naranja sin pulpa para hacer el sorbete más suave.

Sorbete de Champaña y Melocotón

Esta receta de sorbete de melocotón spritzy es una forma rápida de utilizar la fruta madura para hacer un postre delicioso. Para un sorbete más bonito, deje las cáscaras en los melocotones frescos. Si Champagne está fuera del presupuesto, pruebe Cava español o Prosecco italiano.

Dulce de patata y frijol negro

74
Haga un lote doble de este chile vegetariano rápido, lleno de frijoles negros y batatas, y cómalo para el almuerzo al día siguiente o congele los extras para otra noche. Nos encanta el calor ahumado del chipotle molido, pero omítelo si prefiere un chile suave. Sirve con totopos o pan de maíz y ensalada de col.

Maple-Nut Granola

26
Nos encanta la combinación de sabores de arce y nuez de esta granola saludable para el corazón, pero siéntase libre de sustituir sus frutos secos o frutas secas favoritas por su propia mezcla personalizada.

Batido de frambuesa y aguacate

9
Un aguacate cremoso hace una aparición sorpresa en una bebida dulce.

Gorp

7
Try customizing this basic recipe with your favorite dried fruits and nuts.
ADVERTISEMENT

Skinny Pineapple Margaritas

1
Pineapple juice adds plenty of sweetness to this no-sugar-added margarita recipe.

Rainbow Veggie Spring Roll Bowl

3
With tons of colorful vegetables, sesame rice noodles and a healthy peanut sauce, this noodle bowl is a hit with adults and kids alike. Assemble the bowls before serving or let everyone make their own. Serve with Sriracha hot sauce, if desired.

Slow-Cooker Dal Makhani

4
Using a slow cooker for this dal curry recipe is brilliant--the lentils cook until they're perfectly tender. For the creamiest results, use whole urad dal (versus split), which you can get online or at Indian markets. This particular bean breaks down beautifully, giving the dish its rich, creamy texture. For a stovetop variation, see below. Serve it over rice with Indian-style green chutney and a side of plain yogurt.
ADVERTISEMENT

Roasted Kalettes with Pine Nuts & Currants

Kalettes are a relatively new hybrid of kale and Brussels sprouts. When roasted in this healthy side dish, they get crispy on the outside and stay tender on the inside. Look for kalettes near other bagged vegetables in the produce section.

Sesame Noodles with Baked Tofu

La salsa hoisin china le da a esta receta saludable de fideos de sésamo un toque de dulzura. Asegúrate de enjuagar los fideos hasta que estén fríos, luego dales un buen batido en el colador hasta que estén bien drenados. ¿Eres un profesional en espiral? Cambie 5 tazas de calabacín, zanahoria u otros "fideos" vegetales crudos por la pasta cocida.

Fechas rellenas de almendras

Las fechas de Medjool son más suaves que sus primos semidesiertos de Deglet Noor y, por lo tanto, es mucho más fácil rellenarlas con almendras. Esta receta saludable de bocadillos también se puede convertir en un aperitivo adictivo añadiendo un poco de queso azul al relleno.

Smoothie de spa de sandía

Siéntese y relájese con esta refrescante receta de licuado de frutas. Los sabores frescos del pepino, la sandía y la menta se combinan para hacer una bebida saludable que recuerda a un jugo entero que te hará sentir como si estuvieras en el spa.

Chile-Lime-Honeydew Pops

Chile le da a esta receta de pop congelado una irresistible (pero opcional) ráfaga de calor. Jalapeño intensifica el verde del melazo, pero una pizca de chile Aleppo molido puede hacerle sentir la quemadura de una manera más sofisticada.

Ensalada fresca de Tomatillo

1
Esta ensalada súper fresca aderezada con pimiento rojo aplastado es un tumulto de sabores y texturas: tomatillos agrios, tomates maduros dulces y jugosos y jícama refrescante y crujiente. Es un acompañamiento excelente para un bistec a la parrilla.

Sandía Agua Fresca

6
Esta refrescante bebida es servida por vendedores ambulantes en todo México. No mucha fruta, no mucha azúcar, solo una hermosa manera de saciar tu sed en un día de verano.

Salsa de naranja y miso

El aceite de linaza suave y nuez, la fuente vegetal más rica en ácidos grasos omega-3, proporciona la base perfecta para miso salado y jugo de naranja dulce. Esta salsa es deliciosa sobre berenjena a la parrilla, pescado y pollo o se usa como aderezo para ensaladas.
ANUNCIO

Herbed Corn & Edamame Succotash

6
Las sojas verdes frescas, llamadas edamame o frijoles dulces, son una gran adición a este clásico plato estadounidense, donde representan los tradicionales frijoles de lima. El succotash es maravilloso, ya que está cubierto con camarones a la parrilla, salmón o pollo.

Paté de setas

3
Sirva esta receta vegetariana de paté como aperitivo con galletas saladas y cebollas encurtidas o pruébela como un sándwich para untar. La levadura nutricional, rica en vitamina B12, agrega un sabor cursi sin lácteos. Busque el polvo de levadura amarilla o copos en las tiendas de alimentos naturales.

Ensalada de maíz, rúcula y tomate

1
El maíz y los tomates frescos hacen una ensalada de verano especialmente atractiva y deliciosa. El maíz dulce equilibra la rúcula picante y los tomates agrios.

Marinada de cítricos marroquíes

Esta receta de marinado fácil para pollo, pavo, cerdo, cordero o tofu combina zumos cítricos y jugos con especias aromáticas que mejoran el sabor. Para obtener el mejor sabor, marinar la carne (o tofu) durante al menos 4 horas y hasta 8 horas. Sacuda cualquier adobo excedente antes de cocinar.

Nabos en escabeche

2
Los nabos en escabeche son mezes populares del Medio Oriente. Agregar una rebanada de remolacha a cada recipiente hace que los nabos se vuelvan rosados; puede omitir este paso si lo desea.
ANUNCIO

Encurtidos de pan y mantequilla

Prueba estos encurtidos y ácidos pepinillos en un sándwich de atún o picados en salsa tártara para filetes de pescado salteados.

Coles de Bruselas encurtidas

2
Si bien es posible que no pienses en encurtir las coles de Bruselas, hacen una deliciosa guarnición para un Bloody Mary.

Salsa Rojo

6
Aquí hay una versión casera de la salsa de tomate que se sirve en puestos de tacos y burritos en todas partes. Pruébalo con todas tus comidas mexicanas favoritas, incluso funciona como salsa enchilada.

Ensalada de espinacas marchitas con vinagreta de jerez

Esta ensalada de espinacas marchitas no sigue la tradición del tocino y el huevo, pero tiene un gran sabor con vinagre de jerez, un toque de pimentón ahumado y aceitunas salteadas.

Ensalada de papa del Medio Oriente

En esta receta saludable de ensalada de papa, una vinagreta con comino cubre las papas, el calabacín y la espinaca tierna. Las papas cerosas, como el rojo y el amarillo, son la mejor ensalada de papa porque mantienen su forma cuando se cocinan. Mantenga las pieles de papa para más fibra y potasio.

Ensalada de pimienta siciliana

El sabor definitorio de esta receta de ensalada de pimientos es la audaz adición de vinagre y azúcar que le da el sabor agridulce que es tan común en la cocina siciliana. Sirva con pollo asado o asado y una ensalada verde mixta.
ADVERTISEMENT

Spicy Indian Spice Mix

Haga una gran cantidad de esta mezcla de especias de la India para tener a mano cuando necesite batir un rápido aderezo de vegetales o aderezo de ensalada sabroso y fácil. O inténtalo como un toque para carne o verduras a la parrilla o asadas. La mezcla de especias también es perfecta para obsequiar como regalo de anfitriona junto con una tarjeta de recetas para convertirla en una salsa o vinagreta (consulte las sugerencias a continuación). Para obtener las especias más frescas y económicas, diríjase a una tienda que tenga un amplio y bien surtido departamento de especias a granel.

Ponche de ron de pera

1
Las peras maduras en puré endulzan naturalmente la base afrutada de esta saludable receta de ponche de ron. Para adornar, corte rodajas finas y delgadas de peras pequeñas y colóquelas encima.

Granizado de café

This weight-loss tonic might help you slim down, even though it's not a quick fix for healthy habits. Apple cider vinegar's sour flavor (the acetic acid) may help you eat less and stay more satisfied. Green tea has caffeine and antioxidants that may help boost fat loss. Ginger might help you burn more calories. And maple syrup adds a touch of natural sweetness to this hydrating drink. Add this tonic to your diet in addition to sensible eating and exercise to help boost your weight-loss efforts.

Coconut Whipped Cream

Coconut whipped cream, also known as vegan whipped cream, is the perfect topping for any dairy-free or vegan dessert. It's light, creamy and entirely plant-based. Like regular whipped cream, you can also add flavoring--citrus zest, espresso powder or a different extract--to this basic recipe to customize the flavor. Farro Salad with Cranberries & Persimmons

1
When shopping for this healthy salad recipe, be sure to pick up the right type of persimmons. The flat-bottomed Fuyus called for here are bright orange and have texture of an almost-ripe peach when ready to eat--perfect for salsas and salads, with or without the peel. Oval-shaped, darker orange and larger Hachiyas are only edible when almost liquid on the inside. The flesh is best used in baking or can be scooped out of the skin and eaten like custard. Underripe, they are off-puttingly tart.

Chocolate de Agua (Mexican Hot Chocolate)

Dark, bittersweet hot chocolate--made with water, not milk--is enjoyed in Mexico City as an alternative to coffee. It's prepared with a special Mexican chocolate that usually contains cinnamon, ground almonds and vanilla. Look for high-quality brands, such as Taza, Hernán, Rancho Gordo or Seasons of My Heart, which are sold in hockey puck-size disks. To create the classic foam, you can use a blender, a whisk or a wooden instrument called a molinillo and a tall, heatproof pitcher, such as a chocolatera. Both are available online.

Pudín de baya batida

3
Esta receta finlandesa de budín de bayas batidas tiene una textura única, ligera y aireada. A diferencia de los pudines de estilo americano hechos con leche, huevos y almidón de maíz, esto se hace con jugo de fruta, espesado con harina de trigo y luego se aligera golpeando con aire hasta que la textura recuerda a la pelusa de malvavisco. Elaborado tradicionalmente con zumo de arándano rojo o arándano, aquí los arándanos frescos se cocinan con agua y el jugo se cuece para dar sabor al budín. Si desea usar jugo embotellado, omita el Paso 1 y use de 3 a 3 1/2 tazas de jugo tibio en el Paso 2.

"Kneadless" Black Olive & Herb Yeast Loaves

3

Although the recipe calls for regular active dry yeast, a quick-rise or rapid-rise yeast may be substituted by slightly reducing the total amount used; the rising times may be a little shorter than for regular yeast. Recipe by Nancy Baggett for EatingWell.

Dashi

1
Los copos de algas secas y copos de bonito, cocidos brevemente a fuego lento, crean un delicado caldo de ámbar llamado "primer" o "principal" dashi, la base de la mayoría de las sopas claras en Japón. Para el "segundo" dashi, las algas marinas y el bonito se agregan a una olla de agua nueva (como una bolsita de té usada), lo que hace que las existencias sean más débiles para usar en platos audazmente condimentados como la sopa de miso. Aunque los gránulos dashi instantáneos y las botellas de dashi concentrado son sustitutos que ahorran tiempo, el sabor es menos sutil y refinado que el dashi hecho desde cero.

Maza de harina integral para pizza

26
Para mejorar el perfil nutricional de la pizza, use la mitad de harina de trigo integral y la mitad de harina para todo uso, lo que produce una corteza ligera con un sabor a nuez distintivo. La levadura de levadura rápida acorta el tiempo de elevación a solo 10 minutos, lo que hace que la pizza casera sea una posibilidad para los días de semana ocupados. Use un procesador de alimentos, una batidora de pie equipada con un accesorio de paleta o sus manos para mezclar la masa. Agregue suficiente líquido a los ingredientes secos para hacer una masa suave. Si amasa a mano, mezcle, en lugar de empujar, la masa sobre el mostrador durante aproximadamente 10 minutos; esto permite que el gluten se desarrolle sin incorporar demasiada harina.

Si te gusta el aspecto constante de las rondas de squash, busca un butternut de cuello largo o usa solo los cuellos de una pareja, reservando los fondos con bulbo para otro uso, como muffins saludables o sopa.

Escalera de Caos

En esta receta de cóctel de whisky, el vermut dulce, el limón, la naranja y las frambuesas equilibran los amargos.

Palitos de pan de cebollino y ajo

Salte a amasar o mezcle cuando comience con la masa de pizza preparada en esta receta saludable hecha en casa. Esta receta requiere cebollino y ajo, pero prueba tus ingredientes favoritos para personalizar. Para obtener una textura más crujiente, más parecida a grissini, enrolle los palitos de pan largos y finos y hornee hasta que estén dorados.
